course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Making Sense of Government and Politics
course.description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of government and politics. The first part of the course examines political theory which seeks to evaluate and justify political issues through the study of concepts and ideologies. The second part of the course examines comparative politics which seeks to understand and explain political phenomena through the study of actors, institutions, and their dynamics. Students will benefit with the essential knowledge, skills, and attitude for making sense of various matters related to government and politics in the real world.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in LANG 1401 OR LANG 1402 OR LANG 1403 OR LANG 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)
